stocks.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 23rd
stocks.news:
The PayPal Pop:

PayPal (PYPL +5.76%) shares popped on Monday on news that it could be a takeover target.

Shares are down more than 85% from their highs in 2021, and some companies are eyeing it as an acquisition target.

PayPal operates Venmo, which is one of the largest peer-to-peer payment networks in the world.

economy.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 23rd
economy.commentary:
AI Recession Warning:

Over the weekend, a report from Citrini Research went viral. The firm lays out a scenario in which AI adoption will be successful, but lead to a recession in 2028. The report says unemployment could go above 10%, and the stock market could fall nearly 40%. But before we all freak out... Citrini says the doomsday scenario is just a "thought experiment" and not a prediction.

Tariff Updates:

Last week the Supreme Court struck down President Trump's tariffs, saying they were illegal. But Trump had a back-up plan, and announced a new 10% universal tariff using a different law. Then, over the weekend, he increased that to a 15% universal tariff — which is the legal limit. The E.U. responded by pausing its talks for a trade deal with the U.S.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 23rd
crypto.commentary:
It's no secret that "selling high" is what most traders and investors try to do. But recently, some big crypto players have been selling into weakness, or selling even as prices drop.

Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin has sold millions of dollars worth of the crypto in the last few days.

real_estate.homebuilder: Shore Consulting and Zonda have announced a strategic partnership to align premier sales and marketing leadership events for homebuilder executives in 2026.
real_estate.commentary:
The Bay Area remains a strong seller's market with extremely tight supply, particularly for single-family homes in Santa Clara and Alameda Counties, where inventory sits at approximately 0.9 to 1.1 months.

Latest Real Estate News in the Bay Area:

• Divergence in East Bay Property Types: While single-family home prices in Alameda County rose 2.86% year-over-year to a median of $1,150,000, the condominium market saw a 6.36% price decline. Single-family homes are moving quickly in about 19 days, whereas condos are sitting for an average of 51 days.

• Silicon Valley Inventory Crisis: Santa Clara County's single-family home inventory is down 12% compared to last year. This scarcity has kept the region in a firm seller's market, even as the median single-family home price saw a modest year-over-year dip of 3.89% to $1,730,051.

• Shifts in Homeowner Mobility: Economic analysts suggest that the "lock-in" effect of low pandemic-era mortgage rates is slowly fading as more homeowners now hold rates above 6%. However, sluggish hiring confidence may now be a larger constraint on household mobility than borrowing rates alone.
